questions.title: Question 1 - Monitor the health of the analytics pipelines

choices.title: Best Practice 1.1 - Validate the data quality of source systems before moving to analytics (Required)

helpfulResource.displayText: Suggestion 1.1.1 - Implement data validation mechanisms; Suggestion 1.1.2 - Notify stakeholders and use business logic to determine how to remediate data that is not valid.

improvementPlan.displayText: Suggestion 1.1.1 - Implement data validation mechanisms; Suggestion 1.1.2 - Notify stakeholders and use business logic to determine how to remediate data that is not valid.

choices.title: Best Practice 1.2 - Monitor the planned arrival of recent data from the source systems (Required)

helpfulResource.displayText: Suggestion 1.2.1 - Monitor for the arrival or availability of new data, and notify if the expected duration between data arrival is too long.

improvementPlan.displayText: Suggestion 1.2.1 - Monitor for the arrival or availability of new data, and notify if the expected duration between data arrival is too long.

choices.title: Best Practice 1.3 - Define and measure the schedules of recurring analytics jobs (Required)

helpfulResource.displayText: Suggestion 1.3.1 - Monitor the start time for recurring analytics processing jobs compared to the expected start time.

improvementPlan.displayText: Suggestion 1.3.1 - Monitor the start time for recurring analytics processing jobs compared to the expected start time.

choices.title: Best Practice 1.4 - Define and measure the runtime durations of analytics jobs (Required)

helpfulResource.displayText: Suggestion 1.4.1 - Monitor the start and end times for analytics processing steps or the overall analytics job.

improvementPlan.displayText: Suggestion 1.4.1 - Monitor the start and end times for analytics processing steps or the overall analytics job.

choices.title: Best Practice 1.99 - End of Question (Answer to trigger Risk Rules check)

helpfulResource.displayText: Best Practice 1.99 - End of Question (Answer to trigger Risk Rules check)

improvementPlan.displayText: Best Practice 1.99 - End of Question (Answer to trigger Risk Rules check)

questions.title: Question 2 - Modernize deployment of the analytics jobs and applications

choices.title: Best Practice 2.1 - Use version control for job and application changes (Recommended)

helpfulResource.displayText: Suggestion 2.1.1 - Implement infrastructure as code and application logic version control systems.

improvementPlan.displayText: Suggestion 2.1.1 - Implement infrastructure as code and application logic version control systems.

choices.title: Best Practice 2.2 - Set up testing data and a staging environment (Recommended)

helpfulResource.displayText: Suggestion 2.2.1 - Use a curated dataset to test application logic and performance improvements, such that code changes can be comparatively analyzed for the desired outcomes; Suggestion 2.2.2 - Use a random sample of recent data to validate application edge cases and regressions have not been introduced; Suggestion 2.2.3 - Establish separate staging environments to fully test changes before going live.

improvementPlan.displayText: Suggestion 2.2.1 - Use a curated dataset to test application logic and performance improvements, such that code changes can be comparatively analyzed for the desired outcomes; Suggestion 2.2.2 - Use a random sample of recent data to validate application edge cases and regressions have not been introduced; Suggestion 2.2.3 - Establish separate staging environments to fully test changes before going live.

choices.title: Best Practice 2.3 - Test and validate analytics jobs and application deployments (Recommended)

helpfulResource.displayText: Suggestion 2.3.1 - Automate the deployment and testing of changes to infrastructure and applications.

improvementPlan.displayText: Suggestion 2.3.1 - Automate the deployment and testing of changes to infrastructure and applications.

choices.title: Best Practice 2.4 - Roll back failed deployments and backfill the data (Recommended)

helpfulResource.displayText: Suggestion 2.4.1 - Use infrastructure as code and version control systems so that a failed deployment can be rolled back to a previous good state.

improvementPlan.displayText: Suggestion 2.4.1 - Use infrastructure as code and version control systems so that a failed deployment can be rolled back to a previous good state.

choices.title: Best Practice 2.5 - Build standard operating procedures for deployment, test, rollback, and backfill tasks (Recommended)

helpfulResource.displayText: Suggestion 2.5.1 - Document and use standard operating procedures for implementing changes in your analytics workload.

improvementPlan.displayText: Suggestion 2.5.1 - Document and use standard operating procedures for implementing changes in your analytics workload.

choices.title: Best Practice 2.6 - Automate the standard operating procedures (Recommended)

helpfulResource.displayText: Suggestion 2.6.1 - Use automation to perform changes to underlying analytics infrastructure or application logic.

improvementPlan.displayText: Suggestion 2.6.1 - Use automation to perform changes to underlying analytics infrastructure or application logic.

choices.title: Best Practice 2.99 - End of Question (Answer to trigger Risk Rules check)

helpfulResource.displayText: Best Practice 2.99 - End of Question (Answer to trigger Risk Rules check)

improvementPlan.displayText: Best Practice 2.99 - End of Question (Answer to trigger Risk Rules check)

questions.title: Question 3 - Build financial accountability models for data and workload usage

choices.title: Best Practice 3.1 - Measure and notify of the data storage and processing costs per user of the workload (Recommended)

helpfulResource.displayText: Suggestion 3.1.1 - Use tagging or other attribution methods to identify data storage ownership.

improvementPlan.displayText: Suggestion 3.1.1 - Use tagging or other attribution methods to identify data storage ownership.

choices.title: Best Practice 3.2 - Allow downstream systems to use their own resources for analytics jobs (byo infrastructure) (Recommended)

helpfulResource.displayText: Suggestion 3.2.1 - Perform regular reviews of analytics operations to determine if the business will benefit from teams managing their own infrastructure; Suggestion 3.2.2 - Use infrastructure as code and governance tools, such as AWS Service Catalog, to allow teams to self-provision infrastructure within approved constraints.

improvementPlan.displayText: Suggestion 3.2.1 - Perform regular reviews of analytics operations to determine if the business will benefit from teams managing their own infrastructure; Suggestion 3.2.2 - Use infrastructure as code and governance tools, such as AWS Service Catalog, to allow teams to self-provision infrastructure within approved constraints.

choices.title: Best Practice 3.3 - Build a common, shared processing system and measure the cost per analytics job (byo query) (Recommended)

helpfulResource.displayText: Suggestion 3.3.1 - Perform regular reviews of analytics operations to determine if the business will benefit from shared, centralized analytics infrastructure; Suggestion 3.3.2 - Implement a per-request tracking mechanism which allows utilization attribution to the different teams.

improvementPlan.displayText: Suggestion 3.3.1 - Perform regular reviews of analytics operations to determine if the business will benefit from shared, centralized analytics infrastructure; Suggestion 3.3.2 - Implement a per-request tracking mechanism which allows utilization attribution to the different teams.

choices.title: Best Practice 3.4 - Build an internal billback model for analytics workload usage (Recommended)

helpfulResource.displayText: Suggestion 3.4.1 - Implement a cost-visibility and internal billback method to aggregate the team’s utilization of analytics resources.

improvementPlan.displayText: Suggestion 3.4.1 - Implement a cost-visibility and internal billback method to aggregate the team’s utilization of analytics resources.

choices.title: Best Practice 3.5 - Restrict and record resource allocation permissions using AWS IAM (Recommended)

helpfulResource.displayText: Suggestion 3.5.1 - Create a cost governance framework that uses specialized IAM roles, rather than individual IAM users, to provision costly infrastructure; Suggestion 3.5.2 - Use IAM logs to attribute users assuming these specialized IAM roles for cost attribution.

improvementPlan.displayText: Suggestion 3.5.1 - Create a cost governance framework that uses specialized IAM roles, rather than individual IAM users, to provision costly infrastructure; Suggestion 3.5.2 - Use IAM logs to attribute users assuming these specialized IAM roles for cost attribution.

choices.title: Best Practice 3.99 - End of Question (Answer to trigger Risk Rules check)

helpfulResource.displayText: Best Practice 3.99 - End of Question (Answer to trigger Risk Rules check)

improvementPlan.displayText: Best Practice 3.99 - End of Question (Answer to trigger Risk Rules check)

choices.title: Best Practice 4.1 - Understand data classifications and their protection policies (Required)

helpfulResource.displayText: Suggestion 4.1.1 - Identify classification levels; Suggestion 4.1.2 - Define access rules; Suggestion 4.1.3 - Identify security zone models to isolate data based on classification; Suggestion 4.1.4 - Identify sensitive information and define protection policies.

improvementPlan.displayText: Suggestion 4.1.1 - Identify classification levels; Suggestion 4.1.2 - Define access rules; Suggestion 4.1.3 - Identify security zone models to isolate data based on classification; Suggestion 4.1.4 - Identify sensitive information and define protection policies.

choices.title: Best Practice 4.2 - Identify the source data owners and have them set the data classifications (Required)

helpfulResource.displayText: Suggestion 4.2.1 - Assign owners per each dataset; Suggestion 4.2.2 - Define attestation scope and reviewer as additional scope for sensitive data; Suggestion 4.2.3 - Set expiry for data ownership and attestation, and have owners reconfirm periodically.

improvementPlan.displayText: Suggestion 4.2.1 - Assign owners per each dataset; Suggestion 4.2.2 - Define attestation scope and reviewer as additional scope for sensitive data; Suggestion 4.2.3 - Set expiry for data ownership and attestation, and have owners reconfirm periodically.

choices.title: Best Practice 4.3 - Record data classifications into the Data Catalog so that analytics workload can understand (Required)

helpfulResource.displayText: Suggestion 4.3.1 - Use tags to indicate the data classifications; Suggestion 4.3.2 - Record lineage of data to track changes in the Data Catalog.

improvementPlan.displayText: Suggestion 4.3.1 - Use tags to indicate the data classifications; Suggestion 4.3.2 - Record lineage of data to track changes in the Data Catalog.

choices.title: Best Practice 4.4 - Implement encryption policies for each class of data in the analytics workload (Required)

helpfulResource.displayText: Suggestion 4.4.1 - Implement encryption policies for data at rest and in transit.

improvementPlan.displayText: Suggestion 4.4.1 - Implement encryption policies for data at rest and in transit.

choices.title: Best Practice 4.5 - Implement retention and backup policies for each class of data in the analytics workload (Required)

helpfulResource.displayText: Suggestion 4.5.1 - Create backup requirements and policies based on data classifications; Suggestion 4.5.2 - Create data retention requirement policies based on the data classifications.

improvementPlan.displayText: Suggestion 4.5.1 - Create backup requirements and policies based on data classifications; Suggestion 4.5.2 - Create data retention requirement policies based on the data classifications.

choices.title: Best Practice 4.6 - Require downstream systems honor the data classifications (Recommended)

helpfulResource.displayText: Suggestion 4.6.1 - Have a centralized, shareable catalog with cross-account access to ensure that data owners manage permissions for downstream systems; Suggestion 4.6.2 - Monitor the downstream systems' eligibility to access classified data from the analytics workload.

improvementPlan.displayText: Suggestion 4.6.1 - Have a centralized, shareable catalog with cross-account access to ensure that data owners manage permissions for downstream systems; Suggestion 4.6.2 - Monitor the downstream systems' eligibility to access classified data from the analytics workload.

choices.title: Best Practice 4.99 - End of Question (Answer to trigger Risk Rules check)

helpfulResource.displayText: Best Practice 4.99 - End of Question (Answer to trigger Risk Rules check)

improvementPlan.displayText: Best Practice 4.99 - End of Question (Answer to trigger Risk Rules check)

choices.title: Best Practice 5.1 - Allow data owners to determine who or which systems can access data in analytics + downstrm wklds (Required)

helpfulResource.displayText: Suggestion 5.1.1 - Identify data owners and assign roles; Suggestion 5.1.2 - Identify permission using permission matrix for users and roles based on actions performed on the data by users and downstream systems.

improvementPlan.displayText: Suggestion 5.1.1 - Identify data owners and assign roles; Suggestion 5.1.2 - Identify permission using permission matrix for users and roles based on actions performed on the data by users and downstream systems.

choices.title: Best Practice 5.2 - Build user identity solutions that uniquely identify people and systems (Required)

helpfulResource.displayText: Suggestion 5.2.1 - Centralize workforce identities.

improvementPlan.displayText: Suggestion 5.2.1 - Centralize workforce identities.

choices.title: Best Practice 5.3 - Implement the required data authorization models (Required)

helpfulResource.displayText: Suggestion 5.3.1 - Implement IAM policy-based data access controls; Suggestion 5.3.2 - Implement dataset-level data access controls; Suggestion 5.3.3 - Implement column-level data access controls.

improvementPlan.displayText: Suggestion 5.3.1 - Implement IAM policy-based data access controls; Suggestion 5.3.2 - Implement dataset-level data access controls; Suggestion 5.3.3 - Implement column-level data access controls.

choices.title: Best Practice 5.4 - Establish an emergency access process to the source, analytics, and downstream systems (Recommended)

helpfulResource.displayText: Suggestion 5.4.1 - Ensure that risk analysis is done on your analytics workload by identifying emergency situations and a procedure to allow emergency access.

improvementPlan.displayText: Suggestion 5.4.1 - Ensure that risk analysis is done on your analytics workload by identifying emergency situations and a procedure to allow emergency access.

choices.title: Best Practice 5.99 - End of Question (Answer to trigger Risk Rules check)

helpfulResource.displayText: Best Practice 5.99 - End of Question (Answer to trigger Risk Rules check)

improvementPlan.displayText: Best Practice 5.99 - End of Question (Answer to trigger Risk Rules check)

questions.title: Question 6 - Control the access to workload infrastructure

choices.title: Best Practice 6.1 - Prevent unintended access to the infrastructure (Required)

helpfulResource.displayText: Suggestion 6.1.1 - Ensure that resources in the infrastructure have boundaries.

improvementPlan.displayText: Suggestion 6.1.1 - Ensure that resources in the infrastructure have boundaries.

choices.title: Best Practice 6.2 - Implement least permissions policy for source and downstream systems (Required)

helpfulResource.displayText: Suggestion 6.2.1 - Ensure permissions are least for the action performed by user/system; Suggestion 6.2.2 - Implement the two-person rule to prevent accidental or malicious actions.

improvementPlan.displayText: Suggestion 6.2.1 - Ensure permissions are least for the action performed by user/system; Suggestion 6.2.2 - Implement the two-person rule to prevent accidental or malicious actions.

choices.title: Best Practice 6.3 - Monitor the infrastructure changes and the user activities against the infrastructure (Required)

helpfulResource.displayText: Suggestion 6.3.1 - Monitor the infrastructure changes; Suggestion 6.3.2 - Monitor the user activities against the infrastructure.

improvementPlan.displayText: Suggestion 6.3.1 - Monitor the infrastructure changes; Suggestion 6.3.2 - Monitor the user activities against the infrastructure.

choices.title: Best Practice 6.4 - Secure the audit logs that record every data or resource access in analytics infrastructure (Required)

helpfulResource.displayText: Suggestion 6.4.1 - Ensure that auditing is active in analytics services and are delivered to fault-tolerant persistent storage.

improvementPlan.displayText: Suggestion 6.4.1 - Ensure that auditing is active in analytics services and are delivered to fault-tolerant persistent storage.

choices.title: Best Practice 6.99 - End of Question (Answer to trigger Risk Rules check)

helpfulResource.displayText: Best Practice 6.99 - End of Question (Answer to trigger Risk Rules check)

improvementPlan.displayText: Best Practice 6.99 - End of Question (Answer to trigger Risk Rules check)
